topic_metadata.title: How to hide list markers in Polylux?

posts.name: Joel
posts.cooked:
The Polylux book states

Note that the list markers and enum numbers are not hidden. You can truly consider this a bug or a feature…

Let’s assume I’d consider this to be more on the bug side of things. Is there an easy way to hide the list markers?
posts.raw:
The [Polylux book](https://polylux.dev/book/dynamic/obo-lbl.html) states

> Note that the list markers and enum numbers are not hidden. You can truly consider this a bug or a feature...

Let's assume I'd consider this to be more on the bug side of things. Is there an easy way to hide the list markers?

posts.cooked:
This is a general problem with hide, see #619.

A workaround is to set the marker to none inside of hide.

#show hide: set list(marker: none)

// and for numbered list
#show hide: set enum(numbering: it => none)
posts.raw:
This is a general problem with `hide`, see [#619](https://github.com/typst/typst/issues/619).

A workaround is to set the marker to `none` inside of `hide`.
```typst
#show hide: set list(marker: none)

// and for numbered list
#show hide: set enum(numbering: it => none)
```
